meet elena marquez, a 68-year-old hispanic woman living in the metropolitan area of el paso, texas. born and raised in the united states, elena identifies as mexican-american and is proud of her heritage. she is a married, born-again christian who attends protestant services a few times a year at her local church.

elena's educational background includes some college, although she never completed her degree. she attended el paso community college for two years, studying business administration before deciding to pursue a career in sales. she spent 25 years working as a retail sales associate at a local department store, where she developed strong communication skills and built relationships with customers.

elena is married to her high school sweetheart, francisco, a 70-year-old retired mechanic. they have two grown children, both in their 40s, and four grandchildren who live nearby. the couple owns a modest, two-bedroom home in a predominantly hispanic neighborhood, which they purchased in the 1980s.

after retiring from her sales job at 62, elena took on a part-time position as a customer service representative at a local call center to supplement her husband's pension and their social security benefits. their combined household income is around $25,000 per year, placing them in the lower-income tier. despite financial constraints, elena values their modest lifestyle and feels grateful for the support of her family and community.

elena is an avid user of the internet, accessing it several times a day to stay informed about local news, connect with family and friends on social media, and shop online. however, she does not engage in volunteer work due to time constraints and health issues.

as a registered voter, elena is certain about her voting status and feels it is her civic duty to participate in elections. she identifies as a moderate republican, leaning towards conservative values due to her strong faith and traditional upbringing. her political priorities include issues related to healthcare, social security, and economic growth. elena is concerned about the rising cost of living, particularly the increasing property taxes in her neighborhood, which affect her fixed income.

elena's life experiences, family values, and faith significantly shape her political views. she is moderate in her ideology, willing to listen to different perspectives, but ultimately prioritizes policies that align with her christian values and support the well-being of her community.
